intro: Cornutia odorata var. colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian sweetshrub, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and have a distinct aromatic scent when crushed. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
